modules.description: Applies a function to each element within a wrapped value, transforming its contents while preserving the structure. Operates on a parameterized type that encapsulates a single value. Used to adapt values within a context, such as converting options or results while maintaining their computational context.

Applies two separate functions to the components of a pair, transforming each element independently. Works with tuples represented as the ('a, 'b) t type. Used to simultaneously adjust values in a structured pair, such as modifying coordinates and timestamps in a time-stamped position record.

Provides functions to manage name contexts in term manipulation, including creating fresh names, reserving names, and controlling how constant binders are represented. Operates on a context type that tracks bound and reserved names. Used to ensure consistent name handling in lambda terms, such as generating "λx.λx.x" instead of "λx.λx0.x0" by managing binder resets and name reservations.

Provides operations for binding, substituting, and traversing variables within higher-order abstract syntax structures. Works with term representations that include bound variables, such as lambda expressions and quantified logical formulas. Enables accurate manipulation of nested scopes in language interpreters and theorem provers.

Provides functions to manage name contexts in term manipulation, including creating fresh names, reserving names, and controlling name generation policies. Operates on a context type that tracks bound and free variable names. Used to ensure consistent name handling in lambda calculus representations, such as generating "λx.λx.x" instead of "λx.λx0.x0".
